attributes.action: Lower the voting age from 18 to 16 in the General Election.
attributes.additional_details: We want to have the voting age lowered because it is at 16 in Scotland and Wales, so why shouldn't it be 16 in England? It would give the younger generation a chance to have a say in the fate of their future. Our research has shown that the majority of 16-17 year olds would vote if they could.
attributes.background: We want the voting age to be lowered to 16 in the General Election, giving more younger people the chance to vote.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Allow 16 and 17 year olds across the UK the right to vote in general elections.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548727
